Welcome to the Technical Learn Module

Lets take a moment to check if this module is a great match for you.

elements.name: user_type
elements.title: What type of user are you?

elements.name: early_adopter_info
elements.html: In this case we are looking for Early Adopters are comfortable building from code and seeing the latest features.

elements.name: preview_user_info
elements.html: Preview Users are comfortable using Experimental features to complete the learning modules.

elements.name: general_availability_user_info
elements.html: General Availability Users who are comfortable using command line tools and willing to wait for features to be released to wider availability.

elements.name: comfort_level
elements.title: Are you comfortable with the following?
choices: Installing Power Platform Command Line Tools
Using Visual Studio Code to author and edit tests

elements.name: recommendation
elements.html: The learn module is a great match for you! As an Early Adopter and Code-first Developer, you will be building from source code and using the latest feature branches.

elements.name: recommendation
elements.html: You might need to wait a little longer until features are available as part of the Power Platform CLI. Stay tuned for updates as the features are updated in the Power Platform Command Line Interface!

elements.name: recommendation
elements.html: Keep an eye on this site for future updates. The learn module will be available once the features are released to wider availability and beyond Experimental features.

elements.name: recommendation
elements.html: As a Low-code Maker, you might find the learn module challenging if you are not comforatble installing command line tools. Consider exploring modules tailored for low-code development like record and replay.

elements.name: recommendation
elements.html: As a Business User, this learn module might not be the best fit if you are not comforatble installing command line tools. Look for modules that focus on business applications and low-code solutions like the record and replay to share with your team.

elements.name: recommendation
elements.html: As an Architect, you may find this module useful for understanding the latest features and how they can be integrated into your solutions. However, if it involves hands-on command line tools, you might want to collaborate with developers or advanced makers.
